channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Quarter of Your Retirement Fund Just Isn't Keeping Up
item.description: International stocks keep lagging behind U.S. companies, yet they make up nearly a quarter of target-date funds on average.

item.title: CrowdStrike's post-earnings stock drop is a buy. Here's why sellers have it all wrong
item.description: The stock drop plays right into our hands.

item.title: New Zealand Shares Fall 1.2% From Three-Year High
item.description: New Zealand’s NZX-50 closed 1.2% lower at 13053.56, pulling back from a three-year high on broad-based losses.

item.title: Nordstrom tops Wall Street’s earnings expectations, as shoppers buy more clothes and shoes
item.description: The retailer's sales growth is notable at a time when discretionary merchandise and the luxury sector have been under pressure.

item.title: Workday stock slips on light quarterly forecast
item.description: Workday called for a 25% adjusted operating margin in the current quarter, below Wall Street's estimate of 25.5%.

item.title: EasyJet rakes in record $4.5 billion from fare add-ons as CEO slams 'unfair' penalty over practice
item.description: "It's a highly unfair idea that you should not be able to offer products and services targeted for those people who want to use that," Johan Lundgren ...

item.title: Yomiuri Newspaper to Introduce New Stock Index as Alternative to Nikkei and Topix
item.description: Japan’s largest newspaper by print circulation plans to introduce a new stock index next March that it sees as an alternative to the widely followed N...

item.title: Dell shares fall on light forecast despite growing AI sales
item.description: Dell is a top vendor for computers required to develop and deploy artificial intelligence, especially computers based around Nvidia chips.

item.title: Asian Investment-Grade Bonds Likely to Attract Strong Demand at Low-5% Yields, UBS Says
item.description: Asian investment-grade bonds are likely to attract strong demand at low-5% yields, UBS’s Chief Investment Office said.

item.title: Singapore Dollar Weakens Slightly Amid U.S.-Holiday-Thinned Trading
item.description: The Singapore dollar weakened slightly against its U.S. counterpart in somewhat thin trading amid the U.S. Thanksgiving holiday.
